q: Do you sometimes drink more than you planned to drink?
a: If I drink at all, I'll have only one or two before dinner.
b: I will occasionally skip or delay meals to have a couple more drinks.
c: Sometimes a 'few with friends' turns into an entire evening.
d: I have been on benders that lasted for days.

q: Have you ever tried to quit drinking and were unsuccessful?
a: I don't want to quit, I enjoy an occasional drink.
b: I've thought about quitting, but I just haven't gotten around to it.
c: I have tried to control my drinking, but it hasn't worked for very long.
d: I have tried to quit drinking many times.

q: How much time do you spend each week drinking?
a: I only drink on special occasions or only have one before dinner.
b: I only drink on weekends, but I drink almost every weekend.
c: I drink at least three nights a week.
d: I drink almost daily, as soon as I get off work.

q: Do you ever get an urge to drink or a craving for alcohol?
a: No, I can take it or leave it.
b: Sometimes if I have gone a few days without a drink, I'll get a desire to drink.
c: If I skip a day drinking, I'll have an urge to drink the next day.
d: I can't wait until happy hour every day.

q: Do you often miss work or school or obligations at home due to drinking?
a: I don't ever remember missing work because of drinking.
b: I have gone in late before because I was hungover.
c: Sometimes I call in sick when I'm really recovering from a night out.
d: I have lost jobs due to not showing up for work.

q: Has your drinking negatively affected your social or family relationships?
a: No, I rarely drink enough to become intoxicated.
b: Sometimes I have embarrassed myself while drinking.
c: I prefer to hang out with people who drink as much as I do.
d: I have lost friends or relationships due to my drinking.

q: Have you given up hobbies or activities you used to enjoy?
a: Alcohol doesn't interfere with my life.
b: I have skipped a few trips to the gym to drink with friends.
c: I rarely go to events where alcohol is not served.

q: Does your drinking ever put you in dangerous situations?
a: When I drink, it is only at home.
b: I have had a couple of drinks at lunch before and returned to work.
c: I have driven after drinking before, but I was not really drunk.
d: I regularly drive home from the bar.

q: Has drinking caused you any persistent health problems?
a: I don't drink often enough for it to affect my health.
b: On days I drink, I don't sleep through the night.
c: I find that I don't get over morning-afters like I used to.
d: My doctor has told me I need to quit or cut down drinking.

q: Does alcohol still give you the same feeling?
a: One drink still helps me relax.
b: Three beers used to do it, but now it takes a six pack.
c: I changed to liquor because wine wasn't giving me a buzz.
d: I rarely feel intoxicated any more no matter how much I drink.

q: When you go without alcohol, do you get withdrawal symptoms?
a: I don't feel any negative effects from drinking.
b: Sometimes I get a bit anxious, but a drink immediately calms me down.
c: When I go a day without drinking, it is hard to get to sleep.
d: If I don't get a drink by 5 P.M. I get the shakes.
